p: Simulated background time series of daily case counts were obtained from the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention website ( http://www.bt.cdc.gov//surveillance/ears/.datasets.asp, accessed February 20 th, 2010). We chose the s17 and the s33 time series, which mimic typical surveillance data for ARI such as pneumonia, influenza or influenza-like illness, with lower counts on weekend and holidays, long-term increase in counts and seasonality [ 18]. The synthetic outbreaks “08” (Log Normal) or the “04” (Inverted Log Normal) served as the epidemic signal to be injected. Characteristics of the synthetic backgrounds are summarized in Table 1. The datasets are provided as supplementary material ( S1 File).
